tweets.content: @NRGInstitute: Did you miss this session on deepening #opendata impact on open government at #IODC16? @suneetajan moderates http://bit.ly/2ctJzLy pic.twitter.com/omPwFbaXRX
@peetervarga: Starting now in main hall: deepening impact of #opendata in #opengovernment w/ @suneetajan @opengovpart #IODC16 Come join!
@opendatacon: Scaling Up and Deepening Open Data's Transformative Impact in Open Government will start in few minutes in the Main Session Room #IODC16
@nnenna: I'm speaking at Main Session - Scaling Up and Deepening #OpenData's Transformative Impact in Open Government http://ln.is/sched.org/7nNBb  #IODC16

info: The purpose of the session was to bring together leaders from key sector to showcase examples of how open data is deepening the impact of their work and to highlight opportunities presented by OGP to scale up and deepen those efforts. Panelists leave these key messages:

session.description: The purpose of the session is to bring together key sector leaders to showcase examples of how open data is deepening the impact of their work (e.g., natural resources governance through environmental data disclosure, service delivery in health and education, fiscal transparency through open budget data, access to information...Read more

conference_notes:
• Suneeta Kaimal (Natural Resource Governance Institute) : “Open data has become increasingly sexy: too many initiatives are really focusing on flashes but not on the substance”.
  • David Lebryk (Secretary of the US Department of the Treasure) : “The amount of US government data is huge and open data policies are a great opportunity for everyone, even agencies: they needed better access to data to make better decisions”.
  • Nenna Wakinama (Web Foundation) : “We are looking for access to information openness, sustainable, systemic, wether the one who runs is Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump”.
  • Johanna Pimiento (Government of Colombia) : “We have been working with open data policies for more than five years, but this does not mean data is being used. We believe they must release it for specific purposes in order to have a bigger impact”.
name: Scaling Up and Deepening Open Data's Transformative Impact in Open Government
